Thank you for your feedback

We are glad that you love our product. Your ideas and suggestions will help us make it even better.

Thank you for your feedback

We are glad that you shared your ideas with us. They will help us make our product better.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the primary activity of the applicant? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Sell a product/service
choices.feedback: if the organisation served a public purpose or prioritised the collective good beyond seeking to create commercial profits

choices.text: Fulfill a government task
Conduct applied research
Conduct basic research

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the financial structure of the applicant’s organisation? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Largely financed through income from own activities or parent/partner company
choices.feedback: if the financial structure of the organisation was different

choices.text: Largely financed by way of large donations (above 5000€ or equivalent per donation)
choices.feedback: if the financial structure of the organisation was different

choices.text: Largely financed by governments or international organisations
Largely financed by way of small donations (up to 5000€ or equivalent per donation)

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s public reporting requirements? (tick the one that fits best)

choices.text: No reporting requirements
choices.feedback: if the organisation had public reporting requirements in place related to data use

choices.text: Annual report on key financials to financial institution
Annual non-public report on activities to the funder (or other entities)
Annual report on activities to the public

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s legal obligations to provide information to the public? (tick one)

choices.text: No legal options to compel disclosure of information about it data use activities to the public beyond civil or criminal proceedings
choices.feedback: if the organisation could be legally compelled to disclose information about data use activities to the public (beyond civil and criminal proceedings)

choices.text: Can be compelled to disclose information about its data use activities via freedom of information laws

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in providing information about all its activities to the public? (tick one)

choices.text: Demonstrated track record of rejecting information requests (Irrespective of byway of FOI laws, other laws, or voluntarily)
choices.feedback: if the organisation complied (better) with information requests regarding data use

choices.text: No track record
Demonstrated track record of promptly responding to information requests (Irrespective of byway of FOI laws, other laws, or voluntarily)

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s motivation for data use? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Develop/improve new drug/medical treatment
Combat climate change
Combat social and economic inequality

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the main beneficiary of the applicant’s data use? (tick one)

choices.text: Benefits accrue largely to the organisation
choices.feedback: if the organisation's data use did not mainly benefit the organisation itself, but also the wider public or specific groups

choices.text: Benefits largely accrue to users of the product/service resulting from the data use
Benefits accrue to users and non-users of product/service resulting from data use

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in increasing the benefits of the applicant’s data use in the Global South? (tick one)

choices.text: No track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South
choices.feedback: if the organisation had previously ensured that their data use benefits people in the Global South

choices.text: Track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South
Strong track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in strengthening benefits of the applicant’s data use for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law? (tick one)

choices.text: No track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law
choices.feedback: if your organisation had previously ensured that their data use benefits groups that are protected under anti-discrimination rules

choices.text: Track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law
Strong track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s data use’s benefits for future generations? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Benefits primarily cover issues of current relevance
Benefits primarily cover issues of relevance for future generations
Benefits are likely to increase in the future

elements.name: question11
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe risks entailed in the applicant’s data use? (tick as many as necessary)

choices.text: Physical risk
choices.feedback: if the organisation's data use posed lower physical risk to people

choices.text: Financial risk
choices.feedback: if the organisation's data use posed lower financial risk to people

choices.text: Informational risk
choices.feedback: if the organisation's data use posed lower informational risk to people

choices.text: Other risk
choices.feedback: if the organisation's data use posed fewer other (beyond physical, financial and informational) risks to people

elements.name: question12
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe effects of the applicant’s data use on the natural environment? (tick one)

choices.text: Natural environment is negatively impacted
choices.feedback: if the negative environmental impacts of the organisation's data use were lower

choices.text: Natural environment is positively impacted

elements.name: question13
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the relationship between the applicant’s data use and risks? (tick one)

choices.text: Risks stem directly from the applicant’s data use (direct cause)
choices.feedback: if fewer/lower risks were associated directly with the organisation's data use

choices.text: Risks are incidental to the applicant’s data use (indirect cause)
choices.feedback: if fewer/lower risks were incidentally associated the organisation's data use

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the risks for groups afforded special protection under the law (including, but not limited to, children, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, sexual minorities)? (tick one)

choices.text: Data use entails risk for groups afforded special protection under the law
choices.feedback: if the organisation's data use did not entail risks for groups afforded special protection under the law

choices.text: Data use entails no risk for groups afforded special protection under the law

elements.name: question15
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s communication about risks of its data to the public? (tick one)

choices.text: No information provided
choices.feedback: if the orgnisation provided more information about risks of its data use to the public

choices.text: Information about risks provided to the public at some point during the data use
choices.feedback: if the organisation informed the public about its data use prior to the commencement of data use

choices.text: Information about risks provided to the public prior to commencement of data use

elements.name: question16
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the risk of dual use (tick one)?

choices.text: Dual use is likely and conceivable in concrete terms
choices.feedback: if the dual use potential of the organisation's data use was lower

choices.text: Dual use is unlikely but conceivable in principle
choices.feedback: if the dual use potential of the organisation's data use was lower

choices.text: Dual use is extremely unlikely

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the likelihood of a risk of dual use materializing and creating harm (tick one)?

choices.text: Risk from dual use are likely to materialise
choices.feedback: if the risk of dual use of the orgnisation's data use was less likely to materalise

choices.text: Risks from dual use are unlikely to materialise
Likelihood of risks from dual use cannot be assessed
choices.feedback: if the risk of dual use of the organisation's data use could be assessed

elements.name: question18
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s way of assessing risk (tick one)?

choices.text: No risk assessment in place
choices.feedback: if your organisation had (better) risk assessment in place

choices.text: Ex ante institutionalised/ad-hoc risk assessment is voluntary
Ex ante institutionalised risk assessment is mandatory

elements.name: question19
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s way of assessing risk? (tick one)

choices.text: No involvement of persons from outside the organisation
choices.feedback: if the organisation's risk assessment included independent experts from outside the organisation

choices.text: Occasional/Needs-based involvement of persons from outside the organisation
Routine involvement of persons from outside the organisation
No risk assessment in place

elements.name: question20
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the status of findings from the risk assessment? (tick one)

choices.text: Findings are recommendations
choices.feedback: if findings from your risk assessment could be binding

choices.text: Findings are binding and cannot be overruled

elements.name: question21
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the involvement of trained ethicists in the process of assessing risks? (tick one)

choices.text: Trained ethicists are not included in the risk assessment
choices.feedback: if the risk assessment included individuals with specific ethics training and expertise

choices.text: No risk assessment in place
Trained ethicists are included in the risk assessment
No risk assessment in place

elements.name: question22
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the process of harm monitoring? (tick one)

choices.text: No monitoring of harms
choices.feedback: if the organisation monitored harm that is (directly or indirectly) caused by their data use

choices.text: Harms monitored for a limited period during the data use and the deployment of the data use and the deployment of the product/service
Harms are monitored throughout the data use and the deployment of the product/service

elements.name: question23
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the ability of the applicant to stop/reverse their activity, once unexpected harms occur? (tick one)

choices.text: Harm-causing activity cannot be ended immediately
choices.feedback: if it were possible to end the harm-causing activity immediately

choices.text: Harm-causing activity can be ended immediately

elements.name: question24
elements.title: Which of the answers below best describe the remedies available to individuals? (tick as many as necessary)

choices.text: No complaint procedure in place
choices.feedback: if the organisation had a complaint procedure regarding their data use in place

choices.text: Complaint procedure can be initiated online
Complaint procedure designed in an accessible manner
Guaranteed respond times (under 4 weeks)
